meanings.definition: The quality or state of being modular.
meanings.sent1: The modularity of the building's design allowed for easy rearrangement of rooms.
meanings.sent2: The modularity of the furniture made it simple to assemble and disassemble.
meanings.sent3: The modularity of the puzzle pieces made it fun to mix and match them.
meanings.sent4: The modularity of the Lego blocks inspired creativity in building various structures.
meanings.sent5: The modularity of the computer program made it adaptable to different tasks.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a system's components may be separated and recombined.
meanings.sent1: The modularity of the car engine allowed for easy replacement of parts.
meanings.sent2: The modularity of the storage units made it convenient to customize the layout.
meanings.sent3: The modularity of the board game pieces added an element of strategy to the game.
meanings.sent4: The modularity of the music software enabled seamless integration of new plugins.
meanings.sent5: The modularity of the smartphone design allowed for interchangeable accessories.
